data.title: University of Memphis
data.meta_description: Roc Taylor (3) Wide Receiver - Honors • 2023 Second-Team All-AAC • 2023 Fourth-Team All-AAC (Phil Steele) 2024 (Senior) • First-Team Preseason All-AAC (Phil ...
data.text:
Honors • 2023 Second-Team All-AAC

• 2023 Fourth-Team All-AAC (Phil Steele)

2024 (Senior) • First-Team Preseason All-AAC (Phil Steele)

• Biletnikoff Award Watchlist

• College Football Network Preseason AAC Wide Receiver of the Year

2023 (Junior) • Member of the 10-3 Tigers who defeated Iowa State in the AutoZone Liberty Bowl

• One of nine players to start all 13 games on the season

• Totaled 69 receptions for 1,083 yards and four touchdowns on the year

• Became just the fifth player in Memphis history to amass 1,000 receiving yards on the season

• His 69 receptions ranked ninth on the program's single-season list

• Ranked 20th in the NCAA in receiving yards and 23rd in receiving yards per game (83.3)

• Also ranked forth in the AAC in receiving yards per game, fifth in receptions per game (5.3) and ninth in all-purpose yards (83.5)

• Totaled six 100-yard receiving games on the season

• Had five catches for a season-high 159 yards and two touchdowns against South Florida

• Reeled in eight receptions for 102 yards in win over Iowa State in the AutoZone Liberty Bowl

• Also had eight catches for 146 yards against SMU

• Posted seven receptions for 143 yards against Missouri and seven catches for 108 yards against Tulane

• Totaled five receptions for 102 yards and a score against Boise State

2022 (Sophomore) • Member of the Tigers who won the 2022 SERVPRO First Responder Bowl

• Appeared in 11 games on the season, earning one start

• Totaled 20 receptions for 225 yards and one touchdown on the year

• Had a season-high four catches for 48 yards in win over Utah State in the SERVPRO First Responder Bowl

• Also reeled in four receptions for 38 yards in victory against Temple

• Posted two catches for 14 yards with a touchdown at SMU

2021 (Freshman) • Appeared in seven games for the Tigers

• Totaled 8 receptions for 117 yards on the season

• Had a season-high three receptions for 28 yards at UCF

• Reeled in two catches for a season-best 35 yards in win over No. 23/24 SMU

Prior to Memphis/Personal • Three-star recruit and the No. 15 overall prospect in Alabama according to the 247Sports composite

• Had 52 receptions for 1,014 yards and 17 touchdowns as a senior at Oxford High School

• Previously committed to Tennessee before signing with Memphis on National Signing Day
